ground_truth: \nThe water cycle describes how water evaporates from Earth's surface, rises into the atmosphere, cools and condenses into rain or snow, and falls back to the surface to be used again.
response: Here is the rewritten text in the style of Spider-Man:\n\nIn Spider-Man's city, the water cycle is like his web-slinging adventures. Water evaporates and swings up into the sky like Spider-Man, rising high above the city streets. As it cools and condenses into clouds, it's like Spidey taking a break on a skyscraper, catching his breath and recharging for the next web-slinging escapade. And just as Spider-Man swoops down to save the day, the water cycle brings the rain or snow, ready to be part of the action once more, quenching the thirst of the city and its inhabitants."}

ground_truth: \nMultiplication is a way of adding a number to itself a certain number of times. For example, 3 multiplied by 4 is the same as adding 3 four times (3+3+3+3).
response: In Gotham City, multiplication is Batman's secret tool. Imagine Batman needs to signal his allies 4 times, each with 3 bat signals. Instead of sending 3 signals one by one, he uses multiplication to send 12 signals at once, making his efforts more powerful and efficient."}

ground_truth: \nPhotosynthesis is the process by which plants make their own food using sunlight, carbon dioxide, and water. During this process, plants produce oxygen, which is essential for most living organisms to breathe.
response: Here is the rewritten text in the style of Wonder Woman:\n\nIn the realm of Wonder Woman, photosynthesis is the magical process by which plants harness the power of the sun, carbon dioxide, and water to create their own sustenance. This wondrous act not only nourishes the plants but also releases life-giving oxygen for all creatures of the world to thrive."}

ground_truth: \nDivision is splitting a number into equal parts. For example, if you have 12 apples and want to share them with 3 friends, each friend gets 4 apples.
response: Here is the rewritten text in the style of Iron Man:\n\nIn Iron Man's lab, division is like distributing energy to his suits. If Iron Man has 12 units of power and needs to share them with 3 different suits, he calculates precisely to give each suit 4 units, ensuring they all function at peak performance for the next mission."}

ground_truth: \nElectricity is the flow of electrical power or charge. It powers our homes, schools, and gadgets like computers and phones.
response: Here is the rewritten text in the style of The Flash:\n\nIn Central City, electricity is the super-speed force that flows through everything, just like The Flash. It zooms through power lines, lighting up homes, schools, and all our gadgets in a flash, keeping the city alive and vibrant."}

ground_truth: \nAddition is combining two or more numbers to get a larger number. For example, 2 + 3 equals 5.
response: In Metropolis, addition is Superman's way of bringing people together. When he unites 2 heroes with 3 more, they form a powerful team of 5, ready to save the day. Every number he combines creates a force for good."}

ground_truth: \nOceans cover about 71% of Earth's surface and contain about 97% of Earth's water. They are home to a wide variety of marine life.
response: Here is the rewritten text in the style of Aquaman:\n\nIn Aquaman's underwater kingdom, the oceans are vast realms covering most of the Earth, holding nearly all its water. These majestic waters are teeming with diverse marine life, each creature playing a part in the grand aquatic adventure."}

ground_truth: \nSubtraction is taking one number away from another. For example, 5 - 2 equals 3.
response: Here is the rewritten text in the style of Captain America:\n\nIn Captain America's world, subtraction is like strategizing in battle. If he has a team of 5 and sends 2 on a special mission, he knows 3 will stay with him. It's a way to plan and ensure every move is calculated for victory."}

ground_truth: \nThe human body has 206 bones that form the skeleton. These bones support and protect our organs and allow us to move.
response: Here is the rewritten text in the style of Black Panther:\n\nIn Wakanda, the human skeleton is like the vibranium-infused structure of Black Panther's suit. With 206 powerful bones, it supports and protects the body, allowing for incredible agility and strength in every move. Just as the suit amplifies T'Challa's physical abilities, the skeleton amplifies the body's potential, enabling us to jump, run, and move with precision and power. The bones work together like a finely tuned machine, allowing us to perform complex actions with ease and fluidity. And just as the suit is designed to withstand the toughest challenges, the skeleton is designed to protect our vital organs and keep us safe from harm. In Wakanda, the human skeleton is a marvel of engineering, a testament to the ingenuity and resilience of the human body."}

ground_truth: \nDecimals are numbers that have a whole number part and a fractional part separated by a decimal point. For example, 3.5 means 3 and 1/2.
response: Here is the rewritten text in the style of Ant-Man:\n\n\"In Ant-Man's tiny world, decimals are like shrinking and growing in size. When he sees 3.5, it's like being 3 times his normal size and then adding just a little bit more, making him 3 and a half times bigger. Every decimal point is an adventure in changing scale. He's not just a tiny hero, he's a master of fractions, navigating the world of decimals with ease. Whether he's fighting crime or saving the day, Ant-Man knows that decimals are the key to unlocking the secrets of the tiny world.\""}

ground_truth: \nMagnets attract objects made of iron, nickel, and cobalt. They have two poles, north and south, and opposite poles attract each other.
response: In the mystical realm of Doctor Strange, magnets are like enchanted talismans. They attract objects made of iron, nickel, and cobalt, drawing them with unseen magical forces. With two poles, north and south, their power is strongest when opposite poles come together, just like ancient spells aligning to create harmony."}

ground_truth: \nPerimeter is the distance around the outside of a shape. To find the perimeter of a rectangle, add up the lengths of all four sides.
response: \"HULK SMASH... I MEAN, HULK EXPLAIN PERIMETER! PERIMETER IS LIKE MEASURING BOUNDARIES OF HULK'S SMASHING GROUNDS! IT IS DISTANCE AROUND OUTSIDE OF SHAPE, LIKE HULK'S FURY-FILLED FISTS CIRCLING AROUND THE CITY! TO FIND PERIMETER OF RECTANGLE, HULK ADD UP LENGTHS OF ALL FOUR SIDES. HULK NOT JUST SMASH, HULK COUNT! HULK COUNT LENGTH OF TOP SIDE, HULK COUNT LENGTH OF BOTTOM SIDE, HULK COUNT LENGTH OF LEFT SIDE, AND HULK COUNT LENGTH OF RIGHT SIDE. THEN HULK ADD THEM ALL TOGETHER, AND HULK GET PERIMETER! HULK ROAR WITH PRIDE, FOR HULK HAS CALCULATED PERIMETER OF RECTANGLE! HULK SMASH... I MEAN, HULK LEARN!\""}
